summary.p: Inspected the 84 [ancient] coins that Bullinger sent him from Zurich and describes 55 of them; he could not discern details on the others. A more detailed examination could enrich historical research, but it is not possible for him due to the burden of his mayoral duties.

div.p: Joachim Vadian to Heinrich Bullinger, most reverend Antistes, sends greetings.

The coins, which we received from you in Zurich, most reverend man, were 84 in number, whose inscriptions, as you requested from me, I have inspected. However, the following could be certainly comprehended.
1. THEMISTOCLES THE ATHENIAN. - Four figures: two men and two women.
2. Triumphal chariot of L. Saturninus. - Image of a certain woman.
3. Janus bifrons, which is inscribed with these letters: R. I. V. F. M. F. S. V. 4. Philip the Macedonian. Φ. - Horse.
5. Nero Claudius Caesar Augustus Germanicus. - Genius of Augustus.
6. Maur. Numerianus Noble Caesar. - Mars the Victor.
7. Severus Pius Augustus. - Felicity of the Augusti.
8. Aurelian Emperor. - Soldier.
9. Emperor Gabinus S. P. F. Augustus. - Public Felicity.
10. M. Agrippa L. F. Consul III. C. Marius M. Consul.
11. Diocletian Augustus. - Concord.
12. Ox of the Athenians or Delian; whence the proverb βοῦς ἐπὶ γλώττης, that is: Ox on the tongue, which Erasmus notes was worth two Attic drachmas. Y.
13. N. Lentulus.
14. Emperor Caesar Macnentius Augustus. - Victory of Augustus. Freedom of the Romans.
15. Divine Augustus. Father. - Altar of Providence.
16. L. Aurel.c Verus Emperor Caesar. - Concord.
17. Lord Theodosius.
18. Constantius Noble Caesar. - Genius of the Roman people.
19. Emperor Constantine Augustus.
20. Of the Massaliots. - Minerva.
21. Gratian.
22. Divine Julius. S. P. Q. R. - Elephant.
23. Gordianus Flavius Augustus.
24. Philip Augustus. - Single combat.
25. Emperor Caesar Nerva Trajan Augustus Germanicus.
26. Caesar Domitian Augustus Germanicus.
27. Bonovent. Libo. Puteat. Scribon.
28. Emperor C. Maur. Probus Augustus. - Freedom of Augustus.
29. Alexander Pius.
30. Sabina Augusta.
31. Hadrian Augustus Consul III. Father of the Country. - To the Returning Fortune.
32. Caesar Trajan Hadrian.
33. Son of the Divine Augustus. - Cow.
34. Gallienus Augustus. - Sacred to Apollo.
35. Emperor Servius Galba.
36. Vespasian.
37. Antoninus Pius. - Victorious Virtue.
38. Triumphal Chariot of L. Memmius.
39. Lord Honorius P. F. Augustus.
40. Emperor Hadrian Augustus Consul III. P. T. - Spain 41. Nerva Augustus. - Fortune of Augustus.
42. Ancus IC. Philip.
43. Julia Augusta. - Paternity of the Empire.
44. Antoninus Pius.
45. Emperor Claudius P. F. Augustus.
46. Emperor Quintellus Augustus. - Concord.
47. Emperor Caesar Valerius Maximianus. - Virtue of Augustus.
48. Emperor Maximinus Pius. - Peace of Augustus.
49. Domitian.
50. Virgil Maro.
51. Shekel: King Solomon. - Temple.
52. M. Antoninus Emperor Consul. - Two snakes and in the middle of them an altar. 53. Amtau... || O.
54. Single combat.
55. M. CIC. I. M. F. || O.

The letters of the others are so worn and eroded that no suitable sense could be comprehended by examining them. And if only there were someone who could adapt them to histories and the emblems of these and others! For no one can doubt that great light could flow into literary matters from this and many of the most obscure passages of the best writers could be explained and illustrated. But this matter requires more leisure than you might think I have. Indeed, it is so: the intention was to handle something like this; but the highest magistracy offered by the citizens recalled the plan, by which I am so occupied with various and very serious duties that I am not even allowed to visit books, let alone handle and engage with them day and night, as should be done in these studies. Therefore, you will have to find someone else to whom you can delegate this task. Farewell, most reverend man.
St. Gallen, 13th of July, in the year 1530.
